Oh, come now, Doctor, surely you can guess.
Yes, only too easily.
Then why the delay? It's not just their lives. The whole planet is at stake.
Very well then.
Oh, one more thing. Your superior will be arriving shortly.
Superior?

Yes, Earth Control has seen fit to have my project investigated. I want my reforms to have their approval. You and your friends here will confirm the necessity of stern measures. Outbreaks of plague and rebellion must be controlled, don't you agree?
Marshal, you are quite mad.
Only if I lose.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is escorted in.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, here you are.
Well, I gather that you've made a complete hash of things.
This is the situation, As far as we can tell, the centres of crystal contamination have already started to spread, and in some cases link up.
Mmm hmm.
All the living organisms seem to be affected.
Well, whatever we do, we're bound to leave a few bald patches.
It wasn't my decision, Doctor.
Oh, no. No, no, of course not. You were simply obeying orders. That's a common excuse, Professor. Right, now I'll need a macrovisor. The strongest one you've got.
Well, there's only one.
The one you use in the transfer system?
Yes, but you can't use that.
Well, we've got to use it. We'll have to train it on each affected area in turn, like a searchlight.
I thought you were going to use the particle reversal?
I am, Jaeger, I am. But we shall need the beam to transfer the effect from this laboratory to the contaminated areas.
Oh, I see. Er, why?
Well, we can hardly set it up on the surface of the planet now, can we? You've seen to that.
I shall have to get the Marshal's authority.
The Marshal's?
It's not going to be easy. It means isolating Skybase.

Look, for heaven's sake, stop dilly-dallying and let's get on with it. These unstable reactions are dangerous. I shall need some equipment. If we don't come up with an effective control system, we'll particle reverse Skybase and we'll be in a bigger mess than we were before.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The man left to guard the four prisoners gets tired, puts his weapon on the glass table and sits down with his back to them.

Dialogue.Line: (sotto) Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo collapses.

Dialogue.Line: Guard!
Oh.
The girl's collapsed.
Help me.
Well, come on, man! Get over here quickly.
Please, help me.
Hurry up!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The guard picks up his weapon, goes over to Jo and bends down. She snatches his weapon from him.

Dialogue.Line: Right. Keys. And the other thing. (The guard hands over the handcuff keys and the sonic screwdriver.)
Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo frees Ky, who takes the weapon while she frees Stubbs and Cotton.

Dialogue.Line: Well? Now what?
Well, now we've got to get onto somebody of authority and tell them what's happening here.
That's it, Miss. Contact the Investigator.
We can use the Marshal's communicator.
There it is. Right, you do that, I'll block the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cotton activates the baton-comm.

Dialogue.Line: This is Skybase One calling Hyperion. Skybase One calling Hyperion. Come in Hyperion. This is urgent. Repeat, urgent!
Hurry up, Cotton. I won't be able to hold them once they get in.
Skybase One! Skybase One! Come in Hyperion! Skybase One calling Hyperion!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky cuffs the guard to the railing as three other guards blast open the door. He has given the weapon to Stubbs.

Dialogue.Line: Stay where you are, lads. I don't want to shoot unless I have to. Go on, get back!
Come in Hyperion! This is urgent! Skybase One on open channel!
What's going on here? Get him! Get him!
Get back, Marshal!
Give me that, will you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Marshal takes a weapon and fires it into the office.
The Marshal misses everyone.

Dialogue.Line: Skybase calling Hyperion! Skybase calling Hyperion!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stubbs is no better a shot, though.

Dialogue.Line: Go ahead, Skybase One. This is Hyperion.
Stubbsy, we've got 'em!
Well, get on with it then!
What do I say?

Here, let me. Situation on Solos critical. Marshal's attempts to convert atmosphere is causing severe loss of life. The Administrator assassinated on Marshal's orders. Marshal attempting to maintain complete control of entire planet. He must be replaced immediately! Over.
Message received, Skybase One. Request identification. Official information soonest. Hyperion out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Stubbs gets shot.

Dialogue.Line: Stubbsy!
Did you get through?
Yes.
Good lad, Cotton. Good
Come on, Stubbsy. Stubbsy, man?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky takes the weapon and covers the doorway.

Dialogue.Line: Quick, get out. I'll follow.
But what about him?
No need to worry about him. We'd better make for the transfer section. Come on.
We can't!
Not that way! Follow me!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cotton takes them through a door labelled No Unauthorised Entry.

Dialogue.Line: After them! Fool!
What's that?
Ready to isolate transfer macrovisor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gunfire is heard outside.

Dialogue.Line: Huh? Oh, right. Carry on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes to the main door.

Dialogue.Line: No.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: More weapons fire can be heard outside.
Cotton pulls Jo along ahead of Ky and the chasing Marshal. Cotton pushes Jo and Ky into the transfer cubicle.

Dialogue.Line: Transfer system isolating now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cotton tries to get the cubicle to work. The Marshal and his guards arrive. One of them kicks the weapon out of Ky's hands.

Dialogue.Line: Guards!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two guards hold Cotton while the Marshal keeps Ky and Jo covered with his weapon.

Dialogue.Line: Your friend the Doctor again, I'm afraid, Miss Grant. He's cut off the power, no doubt. Take these two to the radiation chamber.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky and Cotton are taken away.

Dialogue.Line: Now, Miss Grant, perhaps you'd be good enough to come with me.
You do realise, Professor, that the slightest accident in this stage of the proceedings.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger nearly drops a long glass rod as he hands it down to the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Tut, tut, tut. The slightest accident in this stage of the proceedings and we'd all reverse instantly into antimatter. Blasted out to the other side of the universe, as a flash of electromagnetic radiation. We'll all become unpeople, undoing unthings untogether. Fascinating.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The rod is all the way in the weather control device.

Dialogue.Line: Got it. Right, all we've got to do is switch on now and see what happens. Or unhappens as the case may be. All right, lower away, will you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger turns a dial and the top of the weather control device is lowered into place.

Dialogue.Line: By the way, I didn't tell you, did I, Professor Sondergaard and I think we've discovered the secret behind the mutations. It's not a disease at all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sondergaard has made it back into the mines, and lies down on a pile of spoil. A guard finds him and is about to fire when a mutant comes up behind and knocks him out.

Dialogue.Line: Listen. Wait a minute. Listen. Can you understand me? Can you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A group of mutants gather round.

Dialogue.Line: You saved me from the guard. Do you know who I am? You know me? I help you. Sondergaard. I help all the mutants, you remember?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They nod.

Dialogue.Line: Good, now listen. How many are there left after the rockets? How many mutants?
Sick. Sick.

No, no, not sick. We know now. You are supposed to become like this. You are supposed to change. Now listen to me, please. But the Overlord's experiments with the air of Solos have made the mutation rate, made the change happen wrongly. Do you follow me? The change can be put right. We know that now. The mutation rate can be made to go as it was meant to. But you must help me. You must help me find the Doctor. Will you come with me and find him? To save your people?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger operates the machine while the Doctor monitors readings on a console.

Dialogue.Line: Now let it build up, Professor. More. More.
You have full power now.
Right. Now here goes. Activation beginning.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A beam flickers down from Skybase to the planet surface, then changes to another location.

Dialogue.Line: What's the reading?
Planet surface no longer contaminated.
The nitrogen isotope level?
Exactly as it was before my rockets landed.
Good, then that's how it stays.
Not so, Doctor. You'll continue to operate this device for me until Solos has an atmosphere breathable by humans, and only by humans.
No!
Very well. Bring in Miss Grant.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo is brought in, and a guard puts his weapon to her head.

Dialogue.Line: Well, Doctor.
Attention Skybase. Attention Skybase. This is Earth Investigator space shuttle Hyperion. We are about to dock. I repeat, we are about to dock.
Well, Marshal, it seems as if your superiors have arrived. What are you going to do now?
Get her out of here. Take put her with the others.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo is taken away.

Dialogue.Line: And now, Doctor, shall we welcome the Investigator together?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The tiny Hyperion docks with an airlock on the end of a tunnel extending from the huge Skybase.

Dialogue.Line: How much longer am I supposed to run Skybase with my entire crew suspended from duty? I refuse to be treated like a, like a
Criminal?
I am warning you, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Guards in white and gold with ECS on their helmets enter, then three men in long gowns and gold 'wigs'.

Dialogue.Line: My apologies, Marshal. And who is this?
This is the Doctor, as I am sure you know.
Your scientific advisor?
Well, surely you know one another?
Should we?
Perhaps I can explain.

Perhaps you can in due course. I've read your report, Marshal, and I should like to begin this enquiry, if I may, by discussing certain matters arising from it. You have been accused of some very serious crimes, Marshal. Well?
Well, Investigator, I'm sure you're aware that all Colony Commanders are faced with accusations of this kind.
Some, Marshal. Occasionally, the accusations are justified. That is why I'm here.

Of course, of course. Of course you are. You see, Solos has been beset in recent months with problems. I mean, an upsurge of nationalism, outbreak of plague, constant and growing attacks and sabotage, culminating in the assassination of the Administrator by terrorists on the eve of independence. It was at this point that I decided to impose martial law.
I see. How severe was this martial law?
Oh, rounding up of political suspects.
There's no report here of any trial being held.
Oh, the prisoners were allowed to escape.
By, er, Stubbs and Cotton.
Er, yes.
Now deceased?
Yes.
I see. Continue.
I then took personal control of the operation and tracked these terrorists to their hideout in a disused mine area.
These would be thaesium mines?
Correct, correct. I ordered the area to be cordoned off and the exits blown up.
And the natives inside?
Oh, they were Mutts.
Mutts?
He means they were all plague victims. They use the caves as a refuge.
Yes, the terrorists took advantage of their unfortunate compatriots. I had no alternative.
And presumably thousands died as a result of your actions?
Unfortunately, but their condition was incurable. I couldn't allow this risk of the plague spreading.
Mutts you say?
Yes. Mutant natives, sir. It's a local term. Medically speaking, accelerated genetic metamorphosis.
I see. You are a Doctor, I take it?
I am, yes.
Qualified in?
Practically everything.
Ah. Well, Doctor, do you agree with the Marshal's diagnosis that the condition of these Mutts was incurable?
Yes, sir. Yes, I would.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hyperion extends its refueling rig. Ky is sweating and shaking.

Dialogue.Line: Look, the walls.
Not long now. Now sure you've got it straight, Miss? Any minute now, Hyperion's fuel probe will come through there. That's how we get out. Okay?
Okay. If we don't get out soon, it'll be too late.
Stand back!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The refuel nozzle comes through the circular recess and opens. It is easily a metre across.

Dialogue.Line: This is it then. Get inside, Miss.
Inside?
Fast as you can. Move! Come here!
Ky!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo, Ky and Cotton get into the hose just before another nozzle comes out of the other wall, where the fuel is stored.
The Investigator consults quietly with his two deputies.

Dialogue.Line: Understand?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger enters and goes to speak quietly to the Marshal at his desk.

Dialogue.Line: Do you realise Hyperion's started refuelling?
Well?
Your prisoners are in the fuel lock. If they caught in the thaesium stream.
Then they'll be totally destroyed. Convenient, isn't it?
Professor Jaeger, the committee will hear you now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo, Ky and Cotton come out of the refueling rig.

Dialogue.Line: Up there. Quick!
All right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They go up a metal staircase just as the chamber becomes too bright to see.
Jo, Ky and Cotton pass back into Skybase.

Dialogue.Line: Right.
Where are all the guards?
Worry about that later. Come on.
Nevertheless, Professor, you were involved in experiments to change this planet's natural atmosphere?
In the laboratory, yes.
The accusation is that you mounted a massive operation to convert the atmosphere to one breathable by humans, but not by the native population.
Nonsense.
And further, that these experiments were the root cause of the outbreak of mutation. Well?
I'm a scientist.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor coughs.

Dialogue.Line: And I rest my case on scientific proof only. Your scientists have made their own tests. The atmosphere of Solos is exactly as it always was. As for the Mutts, er, as for the mutants, I regret that so far we have found no solution to the problem.
Thank you, Professor, that will be all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Investigator confers with his deputies.

Dialogue.Line: Well, gentleman, we have heard the evidence. In the absence of evidence to the contrary I have no alternative but to exonerate you from blame

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a commotion outside.

Dialogue.Line: Let me pass.
And to declare this preliminary hearing closed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo wriggles out of the grasp of the guards and runs up to the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: Stop them! Stop them!
What is going on here? Who are these people?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky and Cotton are brought in by the Investigator's guards.

Dialogue.Line: Investigator, these are the missing witnesses. Jo, Miss Grant here, is my assistant, kept hostage
Lies, all lies!

Kept hostage to ensure my cooperation in this travesty of justice. Investigator, I accuse that man and that man of the most brutal and callous series of crimes against a defenceless people it's ever been my misfortune to encounter.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sondergaard checks out the area then beckons the mutants to follow him.

Dialogue.Line: Come on. Come on. You see? There is nothing to fear. Look, I cannot help until I find the Doctor. Oh, very well, I shall go alone, and you will stay as you are now forever.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sondergaard gets into a transfer cubicle.

Dialogue.Line: You destroyed these poor people for no reason at all.
They would have died anyway.
Not died, Marshal, changed.
It was my duty! My duty to save Solos from contamination!
Duty? Your idea of duty was to keep this planet for yourself.
They're mutants! Mutts! They're diseased! To be wiped off the face of the planet! I
Need I say more, Investigator?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Investigator confers with his deputies, and the Doctor whispers with Jo.

Dialogue.Line: Can you prove your assertion, Doctor? Perhaps we could see these tablets you mention.
Yes, yes, of course.
Well?
Er, no, I'm sorry, sir, I forgot. The tablets are in the care of Professor Sondergaard.
Ah yes, you mentioned him in your report. Where is Professor Sondergaard now?
I'm not sure, sir. Somewhere on the surface of Solos, I believe.
I see. And your other proofs the mutations are not harmful?
Well, I can only reassure you that
He can prove nothing!
As I say, I can assure you, sir, that conclusive evidence does exist.
Where? Where is your proof?
This present mutation is one of a series of adaptive changes, sir. Solos is moving out of spring into summer, and that is why the Solonians are changing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sondergaard is brought in by one of the Investigator's guards.

Dialogue.Line: What is the meaning of this interruption? Who is this man?
This, sir, this is Professor Sondergaard, who's worked and lived on Solos for many years. He can tell you better than I what the Marshal has been doing there.
Doctor, I don't understand. What's happening here?
Don't worry, Professor. We're holding a much needed investigation. Thank heavens you've arrived just in time to tell the Investigator of our discoveries.
Oh, yes, of course. Well, I'm sure the Doctor will have told you of our work in the cave, and he will also have told you that we now realise what's made so many of these mutations to go wrong.
Wrong? But the Doctor has said it was a natural process. Why wrong?
Well, you see
There you see? Even Sondergaard admits it. The mutants are evil! Must be destroyed!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Down on Solos, a mutant finally gets into a transfer cubicle and activates it. Up on Skybase it goes off looking for Sondergaard.

Dialogue.Line: I beg not to listen to this man. The mutants are not monsters. They are the native life form of this planet, undergoing a natural and inevitable change. This change, however, has been brought about prematurely by that man's rash and callous experiments!
That's a lie! Where's your evidence?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mutant enters.

Dialogue.Line: Mutts!
No! There's nothing to be afraid of. The mutants are not dangerous unless you try to harm them.
They're evil! Don't deserve to live!
That is a rational and intelligent creature. To kill it would be murder!
Destroy it or we'll all be killed!
No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky tries to grab a weapon but is knocked down. The mutant leaves, the Marshal takes a weapon and fires at it.
The Marshal guns down the mutant. The Investigator approaches.

Dialogue.Line: There, you see what I have to deal with? More of these creatures may attack us. I want my men released at once. Now! And your men placed under my command.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An ECS guard runs up.

Dialogue.Line: Release the Marshal's men. Obey his orders during this emergency.
You others follow me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cotton is helping a suffering Ky.

Dialogue.Line: They've gone.
What? Who?
The Doctor, his assistant, Sondergaard. These two weren't quick enough.
Right, after them. To the laboratory. Seal all exits. Take these two to the radiation chamber.
But what about the radiation level? After refuelling, it'll be much higher than
That's their problem, isn't it? Take them away.
Jo, take this key. Lock the door.
Right.
Doctor, the crystal, the one you found in the cave. You have it still?
Yes, yes, of course.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes it from his cape, still hanging over the railing.

Dialogue.Line: Yes. Now, all we've got to do is analyse its structure.
But that would take hours.
Yes, well, we haven't got hours, but we do have this. It will help me to accelerate the process, I think.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor attaches the crystal to the particle reverser.

Dialogue.Line: Well, quickly, Doctor!
I'm being as quick as I can, Jo.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The crystal glows brightly.

Dialogue.Line: Yes, of course. Of course! The crystal acts as a bio-catalytic agent. Sondergaard, take this crystal to Ky immediately. But what about the thaesium radiation? Surely that's the vital part of the process?
Well, there's thaesium radiation in the chamber where they took us. Cotton told me.
Well, what else can we do? We must try it. If we hope to achieve a successful mutation, that is.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The door lock blows up and the Marshal enters with guards.

Dialogue.Line: Get away from that machine, Doctor. Guards, take that girl and Sondergaard to the radiation chamber.
So, you've managed to wriggle out of trouble, have you?
I am once more in full control of Skybase, Doctor. A fact you would do well to remember.
Congratulations. Well, what do you want now?

An Earth type atmosphere on Solos. Nothing more, nothing less. Your friends will be confined to the radiation chamber while you work. I am afraid the radiation is at a dangerously high level at the moment, so you'd better hurry, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky is on the floor, twitching. Sondergaard and Jo are pushed in through the hatch.

Dialogue.Line: I'm afraid Ky's just about had it, Miss.
How long has he been like this?
It started as soon as we got in here. The first dose didn't do him any good. Now this lot on top.
The first dose? Oh yes, you were confined here before, weren't you? Well, we'll have to hurry. We may already be too late.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sondergaard places the crystal in Ky's hands.

Dialogue.Line: Now what?
We wait.
We can't wait too long.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky thrashes about suddenly.

Dialogue.Line: Ky!
No, no, leave him.
Look, he's changing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky mutates very quickly, before their eyes.
Jaeger enters.

Dialogue.Line: Watch him, Jaeger. That's about all you're good for, so watch him like a hawk.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor works on the particle reversal equipment. The Investigator enters.

Dialogue.Line: Marshal!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger turns to look and the Doctor switches a couple of leads over.

Dialogue.Line: Investigator.
Why have my men been disarmed and confined to their quarters? What is this nonsense about my ship not being allowed to leave Skybase?
Oh, no nonsense, Investigator. I'm sure you and your crew will enjoy your stay on Solos.
Solos?
Yes, as soon as our good friend the Doctor here has finished his twiddling, Solos will find itself with a new atmosphere. You and the others will be the first settlers on New Earth.
And you, Marshal?
I shall rule from Skybase.
You will never be allowed
Oh, come now. You didn't think I'd let you return to Earth Council? An accident will be reported. Lost with all hands I believe is the phrase.
Other ships will come from Earth.
Oh, they'll be room for them. You should be grateful to help me. We'll begin a new Earth, the centre of a new empire.
It's all right, Investigator. He's quite mad.
Oh no, Doctor. I told you. Madmen lose. I've won. Solos is mine. Have you finished your work?
Almost. And my companions?
Will be released as soon as the job is done.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mutated Ky is glowing.

Dialogue.Line: Why is he drawing all the radiation?
I don't know, my child. We can only watch and hope.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a bright flash and a beautiful person in long flowing robes emerges from the chrysalis, a rainbow of colours drifting over him.

Dialogue.Line: It worked. Thank heavens, it worked!
Worked?
Yes.
Ky? Ky, can you hear me?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky is now a telepath.

Dialogue.Line: I hear you.
It's thought transference. That's wonderful, wonderful!
Yeah, marvellous. But can he get us out?
There is little I cannot do now. Ky thanks you, Professor Sondergaard. You have saved my people. You have shown the way. Goodbye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky floats out through the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Ky!
Goodbye? Great, innit? He just flashes off and leaves us here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The entry hatch swings open.

Dialogue.Line: Out, quickly. Help Miss Grant.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ascended Ky floats through Skybase. He waves his arms as he passes two guards and they collapse.
The Marshal is guarding Jaeger, the Doctor and the Investigator on his own.

Dialogue.Line: Are we ready?
Yes.
Very well.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes over to the atmosphere control machine.

Dialogue.Line: You do realise, Marshal, that you're about to destroy a life form unique in the history of the universe?
Hurry, Doctor, hurry.
As you wish.
Wait.
Change of heart, Marshal?
I still don't trust you. Jaeger?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jaeger takes the Doctor's place at the controls. The Doctor leads the Investigator back to a safer distance. At the Marshal's nod, Jaeger switches on. Smoke then flames start to come out of the machine.

Dialogue.Line: Jaeger! Stop it!
I can't! It's overloading!
Get down.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The machine explodes, killing Jaeger.

Dialogue.Line: Right, out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and the Investigator head for the door.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, you have destroyed my dreams! I'll destroy you!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky appears, standing over the particle reverser.

Dialogue.Line: Die, Marshal. Let there be an end to your torture of my people.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky sends a beam of energy to the Marshal, who vapourises.

Dialogue.Line: I thank you, Doctor, for all my people. Goodbye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ky vanishes.

Dialogue.Line: Professor Sondergaard has agreed to stay on Solos and see as many of the Solonians as possible through to the stage that Ky has already achieved.
But what about the others, the mutants we saw in the caves?

They were premature mutations, Jo. The cycle of changes was triggered off too soon. Rather like butterflies that hatch out on a cold spring day. Their instincts were too confused to seek out and use the crystal.
And now you think you'll be able to help them?
Oh yes, we think so. Ky is on Solos now and, with the crystal, we hope we can save them.
And what are you going to do, Cotton?
Give Ky and Professor Sondergaard all the help I can. Try and clear up some of the mess the Marshal made. Then, do something we should have all done a long time ago.
What's that?
Go home, Miss. Back to Earth.
Exactly. Cotton, you will assume acting command of this base, pending its return to Earth.
Sir.
I take it you will be returning in Hyperion with me? I still require a full account of your involvement in this affair.
Yes, yes, of course, but I wonder whether you'd excuse us for the moment, Investigator? My assistant is feeling rather faint.
Who, me? No, I'm fine now, honestly. I didn't feel too good earlier, but
No, Jo, no you have been rather overdoing it, you know, and you
I have?
You don't look too well.
Really?
Come on. Will you excuse us? We'll see you all, later.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Jo leave.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, who did you say?
Well, here we are.
Where?
The storage area where we left the Tardis.
Oh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But this door will not open to his palm print.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, no. They've locked it again.
More breaking and entering?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo holds up the sonic screwdriver.

Dialogue.Line: Give me that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A quick buzz and the door opens.

Dialogue.Line: Oh well, back to the broom cupboard.
Yes, well at least we've made a clean sweep of this place. (Jo winces) No?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chuckling, they enter the storage room. A klaxon sounds.

Dialogue.Line: Attention! Attention! Computer confirms malfunction in storage area four. Investigate, please. Investigate, please.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis dematerialises.
